name: “Sweety” Espresso Blend
review: A radiant espresso blend that shines equally in the straight shot and in milk, alive with notes of rich dark chocolate and black cherry.

name: Flora Blend Espresso
review: A floral-driven straight shot, amplified with notes of stone fruit and chocolate in cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Ethiopia Shakiso Mormora
review: A gently spice-toned, floral- driven wet-processed Ethiopia cup with pleasing notes of cocoa throughout.

name: Ethiopia Suke Quto
review: Lavender-like flowers and hints of zesty pink peppercorn animate this crisply sweet wet-processed Ethiopia cup.

name: Ethiopia Gedeb Halo Beriti
review: A deeply and generously lush cup saved from sentimentality by a crisp, incense-like, slightly savory edge. Very wide range of aromatics.

name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
review: A lively and crisply sweet, fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

name: Ethiopia Gelgelu Natural Organic
review: A deeply sweet natural-processed Ethiopia cup, with stone fruit and brandy notes as parallel throughlines.

name: Ethiopia Hambela Alaka
review: A delicate, richly sweet wet-processed Ethiopia: spice, herb, fruit and flowers in intricate balance.

name: Organic Ethiopia Kirite
review: An inviting wet-processed Ethiopia cup. Invokes a walk through a citrus orchard in spring, with a bonus of sweet herb and cocoa tones.

name: Ethiopia Sidama
review: An elegantly expressive, fruit-forward but savory-leaning Ethiopia cup.

name: Thiriku AA Kenya
review: Mysterious and extraordinary in the Kenya style: simultaneously sweet, savory, tart and entirely and grandly vibrant.

name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Tore
review: An intense cup, zesty but juicy, alive with rose-like flowers, mint and lime.

name: Direct Fair Trade Espresso
review: A solid espresso blend equally pleasing as a straight shot and in milk.

name: Decaf Ethiopia Sidamo
review: This very light-roasted decaffeinated coffee may suggest a fine, complex Chinese black tea in some respects, though it ultimately enforces its coffee identity with its tart structure and light-footed authority. Oddly idiosyncratic in its aromatics, but quite free of the disturbing wood notes characteristic of many decaffeinated coffees.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Washed G1
review: A cup with a fine-tea-like appeal in its subtle complexity and spice-toned presentation.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural G1
review: A crisply bittersweet cup that leads with spicy florals and sweet herb notes.

name: “Fruity” Espresso Blend
review: Rich, sweet, elegant and cocoa-laden, this espresso blend is nougat-like in the straight shot and fruit- and floral-toned in milk.

name: Decaf Colombia Select
review: Those who value a gently zesty sweetness should enjoy this delicate decaf cup. Easy on the palate, easy on the nervous system.

name: Ethiopia Awassa
review: An engaging, confident Ethiopia cup with layered intrigue: flowers, fruit, aromatic wood.

name: 100% Kona SL-28
review: Coffee simply doesn’t get much better than this. Transcendently classic.

name: Kenya Kirinyaga Mukangu AB
review: A Kenya that covers all the bases: sweet-tart fruit, savory depth, spicy florals and cocoa.

name: Kenya Nyeri Othaya Gatugi Red Cherry Project AA
review: A darker roast develops a savory-toned chocolate to complement a zesty citrus in this pleasingly contradictory Kenya.

name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe Adado
review: A bright, lively, juicy washed Yirgacheffe coffee: classic in structure and style.

name: Outbound Espresso
review: An espresso blend that offers both high-toned florals and low-toned nut and chocolate notes, integrated by a consistent caramel throughline.

name: Ace Espresso
review: A floral-toned, richly sweet espresso blend: balanced, flavor-laden, driven by notes of narcissus-like flowers.

name: Kenya Mutungati
review: A vibrant fruit- and chocolate-toned Kenya coffee, with an exciting hint of lime zest throughout the profile.

name: Guatemala El Retiro del Quisaya
review: Delicate and graceful, yet authoritative in character; seductively sweet.

name: Kenya Peaberry Kericho County
review: An unorthodox but original and engaging variation on the Kenya cup, juxtaposing sweetness and a musky, herby-savory edge.

name: Static El Salvador Finca Maria Luisa
review: Those who value brisk, dry beverages should enjoy this coffee and its quiet, unorthodox aromatic intrigue.

name: Kamwangi Kenya
review: Resonantly pungent Kenya, particularly attractive for its structure: sweet, tart and savory all at once, zesty yet seductive. Holds its character superbly as it cools.

name: Ethiopia Gelana Abaya
review: Spicy-sweet, autumnal profile, complex and grown-up.

name: Ethiopia Bishan Fugu
review: A richly elegant cup that leads with deep fruit notes, as do many natural- processed coffees, though here the fruit is complicated by an engaging musk-like intrigue.

name: Sustainable Harvest Homacho Waeno Natural
review: A natural-processed Ethiopia coffee of intriguing depth, with a wide range of aroma/flavor notes, savory pipe tobacco to high-toned, spicy florals, to crisply sweet citrus marmalade.

name: Ethiopia Amaro Gayo Natural
review: The overall impression of this natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup is equal parts dried fruit and chocolate, nicely elaborated by spice suggestions (cinnamon, clove, nutmeg).

name: Static Colombia Decaf Midnight
review: A solid, chocolate-toned decaf with inviting fruit and floral tones.

name: Diima #9 Ethiopia Natural
review: This natural-processed Yirgacheffe’s hint of sweet, rum-like fruit ferment gives the cup a distinct holiday feel.

name: Sweet Holiday Blend
review: A brightly juicy, sweet blend with richly layered holiday nuance: chocolate, clove, date.

name: DR Congo Virunga Organic
review: An exciting coffee from a newly emerging eastern Congo growing region: savory-edged, richly sweet, invitingly pungent.

name: Holiday Blend
review: A lovely blend of four exceptional coffees that nets a crisp, very sweet, pleasingly herb-toned cup.

name: Kenya Thaitu
review: A spice-toned, floral- and fruit-driven Kenya coffee, grounded by rich chocolate notes with hints of sweet pipe tobacco.

name: Yule Blend 2018
review: A balanced, savory-leaning and richly sweet blend of two quality coffees from Kenya, netting a vibrantly high-toned, spice-driven cup.

name: Los Congos Pacamara Honey
review: An umami-driven Pacamara coffee, with a throughline of berry and sundried tomato notes: sweet and savory in harmonious balance.

name: Coffea Diversa Costa Rica Sudan Rume
review: A fine introduction to a rare variety of Arabica, Sudan Rume: crisp, bright, sweetly tart.

name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti Natural G1
review: An inviting natural-processed coffee from Ethiopia: sweetly tart, fruit-forward.

name: Panama Auromar Geisha Natural
review: A dynamic coffee with complex aromatics that invoke the tropics—and a seemingly infinite finish, richly sweet and flavor-saturated.

name: El Salvador Finca Kilimanjaro
review: A graceful, generously fruit- and floral-toned El Salvador cup with an exceptionally balanced structure and juicy acidity.

name: Panama Elida Green Tip Gesha Natural
review: An elegant, richly sweet natural-processed Panama Gesha with berry and chocolate notes throughout.

name: Gikanda Kenya
review: Superb version of the classic sweet-savory, crisply juicy, fragrantly floral-edged Kenya cup.

name: Panama Don Julian Pacamara
review: Superb Pacamara profile, crisply dry and spicy yet deeply, lavishly juicy sweet.

name: 100% Kona Bourbon Pointu Laurina
review: Intense, bright but balanced cup with layered aromatic intrigue generated by a celebrated and rare tree variety.

name: Kenya AB Muchoki
review: The exciting Kenya tension between sweet and savory-tart is on display here, but a bit softer in expression perhaps, more tropical, than usual. A relaxed Kenya, authoritative yet delicate and approachable.

name: Colombia Nariño Duende
review: Low-toned and deeply rich, reminiscent of Ibarra Mexican chocolate with cinnamon, enveloped in fruit and nut tones.

name: Geisha Panama Santamaria Natural
review: Both elegantly balanced and subtly grand in detail; a quietly spectacular rendition of the Gesha profile.

name: Estate Medium Roast
review: A coffee both classic in its crisp clarity and subtly original in its high-toned fruit and floral aromatics.

name: Ethiopia Holy Grail Natural Yirgacheffe
review: In the straight shot, dark chocolate and tart fruit reign; in milk, spicy floral notes wrapped in chocolate carry the day.

name: Kenya Karinga
review: An intense yet accessible Kenya animated by a zesty but very sweet structure and an intriguing range of aromatics.

name: Thailand Doi Pangkhon Espresso
review: A bright, vivid espresso: Tart citrus in front, enveloped by a softening chocolate.

name: Ulos Batak Sumatra
review: An intricately layered, superb Sumatra cup saturated with chocolate, spicy floral and sweet fruit notes, with gentle intimations of rich perique tobacco.

name: Gaitania Colombia
review: An inviting and accessible Colombia cup, sweet-toned with a hint of cardamom-like spice.

name: Blue Label La Esmeralda Porton Pascua Gesha
review: A symphonic Gesha cup: high-toned fruit and flowers are supported by spice and aromatic wood.

name: Auromar Gesha Natural
review: A crisp, deeply sweet natural-processed Gesha cup: chocolaty, fruit-toned and floral.

name: Haraz Special Red Yemen
review: An attractively idiosyncratic cup from one of coffee’s ancient homelands: mildly fermenty, richly fruity-toned, with hints of earth and tobacco.

name: “Naturals”
review: A fruit-driven, but crisp natural-processed Kona cup that’s also certified organic.

name: Finca Merced Guatemala
review: A sweetly bright, cocoa-toned Guatemala cup with engaging stone fruit and aromatic wood complications.

name: El Peñon Nicaragua
review: Coffee Review’s highest scoring Nicaragua coffee of 2017: crystalline in structure, intensely aromatic, deeply and richly sweet.

name: Kenya Chorongi Peaberry
review: A classic Kenya cup: richly sweet-savory, with a complex array of fruit, floral, chocolate and aromatic wood notes at its intense and inviting heart.

name: Honduras Los Catadores Honey
review: A solid single-origin Central America espresso, chocolate-toned throughout, with pretty floral and citrus zest grace notes.

name: Static Kenya Kavutiri
review: A delicate, spice-driven Kenya cup with engaging undercurrents of fruit, floral and chocolate.

name: Honduras La Lesquinada Washed
review: Makes a particularly appealing espresso in cappuccino-scaled milk: chocolaty, with intense fruit and floral complication.

name: Kenya Gicherori
review: A round, sweetly savory Kenya enlivened by the quiet intrigue of vanilla-like flowers and crisp chocolate.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe
review: A resonant, chocolate-toned Yirgacheffe cup, deeply sweet with floral and aromatic wood undertones.

name: Bufcafe Rwanda Espresso
review: An unapologetically savory-sweet coffee, especially attractive in milk, where both basic taste tendencies are enhanced by notes of tamarind and citrus zest.

name: Bufcafe Rwanda
review: A superior Rwanda cup, classically sweet-savory with an appealing high-toned crispness.

name: Gedeb Ethiopia
review: A big, juicy wet-processed Ethiopia cup laden with rich floral and fruit tones throughout, all enveloped in dark chocolate.

name: Civet Yirgacheffe Sisota
review: An impressively rich sweet-savory cup with a throughline of fennel-like herb notes. Interesting both for its unusual cup and its unusual processing variation.

name: Civet Ethiopia Papilio Sidamo
review: A Sidamo coffee processed by the dry or natural method and treated with a cultured essence of kopi luwak that together net richly ripe fruit notes, cocoa tones, and a pleasing hint of sweet ferment.

name: Estate Carbonic Maceration
review: Delicately bittersweet and cocoa-toned, with flowers hinting at lushness.

name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti
review: A juicy-sweet Ethiopia natural cup: lively and fruit-toned, with a hint of elegant, rum-like sweet ferment.

name: Colombia David Gomez 100% Caturra
review: Engaging Colombia cup with impressively juicy, bright acidity and zesty, spice-toned aromatics.

name: Panama Auromar Estate Geisha Peaberry
review: A vibrant, exhilarating natural-processed peaberry Gesha saturated with rich floral, spice and fruit aromas and flavors throughout the profile.

name: Indonesia Emerald Mandheling
review: Complex and dynamic in structure, balancing tart, sweet and bitter, with deeply layered and complex aromatics.

name: Panama Finca Hartmann Geisha Natural
review: An exciting natural-processed Geisha that leads with juicy fruit notes and deeply sweet florals, all wrapped in frankincense and cocoa.

name: Ethiopia Reko Estate Yirgacheffe
review: Expresses the deep, spicy-sweet side of the Yirgacheffe profile, engaging in its balance of savory depth and perfumy sweetness.

name: Costa Rica Sonora Estate Venecia Natural
review: An engaging natural-processed Costa Rica cup, with top notes of peach and undercurrents of wood-framed florals throughout.

name: Mini-Me Washed Kaffa Forest
review: A dynamic trifecta of flowers, fruit and chocolate in both the shot and in cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Jade Espresso
review: Deep, rich, gently tart, chocolaty as a straight shot; gloriously dessert-like in three parts milk.

name: Firebird Espresso
review: An evocative, richly sweet espresso blend centered on deep chocolate with rich floral and bright citrus undertones.

name: Ethiopia Dumerso Light Roast
review: A balanced yet intricate dried-in-the-fruit Yirgacheffe, flowers grounded in chocolate with a whiff of brandy.

name: Kenya AA Karamundi
review: A cocoa-toned Kenya cup with notes of stone fruit and sweet florals and the added intrigue of a tart, tamarind-like edge.

name: Finca San Luis Colombia Espresso
review: A quietly zesty straight shot nicely rounded and deepened with chocolate and nut. All carry nicely into cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Ethiopia Biftu Gundina Coop Espresso
review: A fine darker roasted espresso: The scorched wood notes are lively and aromatic, the chocolate pleasingly bittersweet; hints of zesty citrus and sweet flowers maintain vivacity.

name: Ethiopia Natural Sidamo Papilio
review: An unusual and engaging natural-processed Ethiopia: crisp, sweet-savory, complex and original in its cocoa, lemon-herb and grappa-toned aromatics.

name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti Natural
review: A perfumy, floral- and spice-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with an especially juicy acidity.

name: Peru Finca Ecológica Agua Colorada
review: A solid Peru cup: rich, deeply sweet, with the intrigue of a perfumy musk-like note throughout.

name: Love Letters
review: A harmonious melding of sweet floral and fruit notes from the El Salvador component of the blend and a more tobacco-toned sweetness from the Indonesia contribution.

name: Throwback Blend
review: A blend in which you can taste the influence of both the Colombia and the Kenya elements, the former chocolate-toned, the latter, sweetly tart. Combined, they generate a resonant, layered intricacy.

name: Costa Coast Blend
review: An inviting blend of two organic coffees, a Costa Rica and a natural-processed Ethiopia, which together create a spicy-floral-toned and fruit-driven cup.

name: Canoe Blend
review: A deep, energetic coffee that juxtaposes bright sweetness and rich earthiness with a dark chocolate throughline.

name: Dead Reckoning
review: A floral-toned blend with particularly engaging acidity, sweetly tart and lively structure, and an intriguing suggestion of fresh spearmint.

name: Miami Winter
review: A deeply attractive blend that evokes the tropics, with notes of ginger blossom and pineapple leading the aromatic charge.

name: Wilderness Blend
review: An elegant citrusy and chocolate-toned cup, pleasingly complicated by notes of stone fruit and rich aromatic wood.

name: Naturals With Attitude
review: All fruit, all the time. But not a hint of ferment, despite the blend’s four dried-in-the-fruit, natural-processed components.

name: Guatemala Retiro Natural Process
review: A dry-processed coffee in the crisp, elegant style, lightly cocoa-toned, subtly complex, long-finishing.

name: Gaitania Colombia
review: Big-bodied, roundly powerful coffee expression, equally nuanced with cedar, dry chocolate and herb hints. Fair trade and organic.

name: Rwanda Remera Kabeza
review: An unusually pure Rwanda, impressive particularly in its fresh, juicy structure and bright composure.

name: Dodora Double
review: An exceptional, vivacious Ethiopia coffee in which high-toned floral notes, sweetly tart fruits, and rich chocolate tones harmonize.

name: Poas Red Honey
review: A honey-processed Costa Rica cup expressing equal parts sweet and tart: think candied apple and pomegranate wrapped in rich, creamy cashew butter.

name: Lekali (Nepal)
review: The first coffee from Nepal ever rated by Coffee Review, and well worth seeking out for its confident savory-sweet cup.

name: Costa Rica Tarrazu
review: A paradoxical natural-processed Costa Rica coffee with big sweetness (fruit and florals) and rich aromatic wood notes in equal measure.

name: Decaf Espresso
review: An inviting decaffeinated espresso laden with notes of dark chocolate and sweet florals. Particularly appealing in cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Summer Night Blend Espresso
review: A lush, floral and richly sweet espresso blend, with dark chocolate tones as the throughline.

name: Ethiopia Reko
review: A classic Ethiopia cup: balanced, bright and deeply sweet, with notes of berry and stone fruit.

name: Sumatra Tano Batak
review: A classic Sumatra that displays its clean, fresh-earth character and grapefruity pungency without apology, supported by crisp chocolate, vanilla bean and pear.

name: Kenya Kirinyaga
review: A complex, richly layered, juicy-sweet Kenya cup.

name: Ethiopia
review: A confident, juicy-rich Ethiopia with appealing notes of citrus and cherry.

name: Ethiopia Guji Deri Korcha White Honey
review: An impressive white-honey processed coffee—richly fruit- and floral-toned.

name: Congo Kivu
review: Inviting notes of chocolate and tea rose carry this resonant, sweetly tart, slightly darker-roasted coffee from central Africa.

name: Three Queens Blend
review: Exceptional, versatile cup. Satisfies with its balance, yet surprises with its lush, layered intricacy. Blending at its most committed and original.

name: Sumatra Mutu Batak
review: A fine Sumatra, simultaneously expressing the pungent, full, resonantly earthy genius of the type, while lifting it with refreshing lightness and complex vivacity.

name: Rwanda Bufcafe Remera
review: A fine expression of the classic Rwanda and Central Africa cup, vibrantly and roundly bright, yet crucially deepened and nuanced by drier and more savory suggestions of lemon verbena and cooked root vegetables.

name: Kiniyota Burundi
review: One of the more impressive Burundis we’ve tested in some years: roundly sweet-toned and bright, crucially supported by a deep savory resonance.

name: Kona Mocca®
review: An out-of-the-ordinary coffee but a superbly balanced and complete one, with particularly seductive floral and chocolate notes.

name: Ethiopia Suke Quto Honey
review: This honey-processed Ethiopia is a citrus and berry chorus, from lime blossom in the aroma to raspberry jam in the cup, backed by continuous suggestions of sandalwood and crisp cacao nib.

name: Ethiopia Worka Natural
review: A natural-processed Ethiopia cup with sweetly jammy fruit character, balanced by cocoa suggestions.

name: Ecuador Pichincha Typica
review: A nuanced Typica from Ecuador: balanced, quietly complex, richly sweet.

name: Kenya Ndnunduri
review: A spice-toned and fruit-laden Kenya cup, distinguished by perfumy, amber-like suggestions throughout.

name: Ethiopia Gedeb Gotiti
review: A crisp, high-toned Ethiopia coffee with rich fruit and sweet herb notes, next to deep evocations of honey.

name: Yemen Port of Mokha Al-Durrar
review: A gorgeous Yemen coffee that rewards the observant drinker with layers of nuance that unfold with patience, touching all the notes: fruit, earth, chocolate, spice.

name: Sumatra Tano Batak
review: This paradoxical coffee offers both high tones and low: notes of juicy tropical fruit juxtaposed with rich pipe tobacco.

name: Sumatra Tano Batak
review: This rich Sumatra invokes the experience of eating cherries in a flower garden next to a patch of fresh, fragrant, just-turned earth.

name: Kenya Gura AA
review: A rich-toned Kenya cup with big, sweetly bright acidity and inviting notes of berry and coconut.

name: Finca La Maria Geisha Natural
review: A natural-processed Colombia Gesha that’s compelling in every way, with bright notes of stone fruit and honeysuckle in the cup, plump mouthfeel and flavor-saturated finish that lingers on and on.

name: Ethiopia Guji Gigessa
review: A juicy, bright Ethiopia cup with engaging fruit and floral notes and hints of rich aromatic wood, with a throughline of crisp, nut-like roasted cacao nib.

name: Granja La Esperanza Sudan Rume Natural
review: An adventurer’s coffee from the get-go. In fact, especially at the get-go, when the odd, intense, sweet pungent sensation confronts us, then softens, opening up to a deep, layered intricacy.

name: Gedeb Espresso
review: Fine wet-processed Ethiopia skillfully medium-roasted for presentation as espresso. Layered and pleasingly shifting aromatics persist throughout, from aroma through the milk shot.

name: Gaitania Espresso
review: A tactful medium roast nicely develops crisp chocolate and subtle floral character in this intense, big-bodied single-origin espresso.

name: Indonesia Flores Island
review: A crisp Indonesia cup from the emerging Flores Island coffee growing region: delicate, with a throughline of tart fruit and sweet earth.

name: Panama Baru Geisha Honey by Joseph
review: An elegant, crisply sweet honey-processed Gesha cup with a throughline of pleasingly tart fruit notes enveloped in chocolate.

name: Ethiopia Sidamo Shakiso Danbi Uddo Mulish Natural G1
review: A delicate, flavor-saturated natural-processed Sidamo cup, animated by notes of raspberry and clove.

name: Panama Baru Geisha Natural by Joseph
review: An understated and attractive natural-processed Gesha, rich with notes of sweet flowers, fruit-toned spices, and bright citrus zest.

name: Static Indonesia Toarco Sulawesi
review: A sweet, richly savory Sulawesi cup with a cocoa and mesquite throughline nuanced by butterscotch and fine musk.

name: Burundi Buhorwa
review: A deeply pleasing coffee from Burundi: rich, profoundly sweet throughout, and complexly layered with fruit, floral and aromatic wood notes.

name: Warrior in the Forest Blend
review: An Ethiopia-Indonesia blend that offers both high-toned sweetness and warm, low-toned spice notes reminiscent of clove.

name: COE Brazil Naturals 2017 Sitio Esperanza 7th place
review: A crisp, chocolate-toned Brazil natural cup, with inviting notes of dried hibiscus and vanilla-like florals.

name: Icamiabas Fazenda Klem Catuaí Natural
review: A fruit-forward, natural-processed Brazil coffee that invokes a chocolate cordial with its predominant note of brandy-inflected dark chocolate.

name: Brazil Chapada Diamantina Fazenda Floresta
review: A confident chocolate- and floral-toned cup with a pleasingly bittersweet structure.

name: Tumba Rwanda
review: Lovely expression of the genius of Rwanda coffees: roundly sweet-savory in structure, resonant in aromatics, luxurious in mouthfeel.

name: Mandheling Onan Ganjang
review: A sweet yet umami-leaning Sumatra cup (think candy cap mushroom) with rich fruit and floral tones throughout.

name: Burundi Nemba
review: A floral- and spice-toned Burundi cup, simultaneously richly sweet and invitingly savory.

name: Static Peru Cajamarca
review: A delicately brisk, sweetly nut-toned variation on the classically gentle Peru profile.

name: Ethiopia Banko Gotiti Natural
review: A brightly sweet, crisply tart natural-processed Ethiopia cup: fruit- and floral-toned with a hint of intriguing cardamom-like spice.

name: Flight Seasonal Espresso
review: A brightly lively, complex yet coherent blend of both washed and natural-processed coffees: juicy, sweetly tart, chocolaty and floral-toned, with a hint of appealing sweet ferment.

name: Yemen Microlot
review: A stunningly balanced, bright, flavor-saturated Yemen cup characterized by rich fruit and cocoa-toned floral notes throughout.

name: Lycello by Ninety Plus
review: Complete: suave, flavor-saturated, big-bodied, sweetly and gracefully bright.

name: Lotus by Ninety Plus
review: For well-heeled coffee adventurers, a coffee so original it is difficult to categorize. It provokes a tremendous range of sensory association that situates it on the frontier of coffee expression, hovering somewhere between disturbing and extraordinary.

name: Guji Allona Ethiopia Natural
review: A classic natural-processed Ethiopia cup with clean berry notes, chocolate suggestions, and hints of sweetly spicy florals.

name: Monteverde Costa Rica
review: A rich, chocolate- and raisin-toned Costa Rica cup, ideal for those who prefer a medium-dark roast.

name: Kenya Nyeri Gatugi Peaberry
review: A deftly darker-roasted coffee with notes of toasted coconut and savory almond alongside spicy florals: a pleasingly old-school presentation of the classic Kenya cup.

name: Karen J Red Bourbon
review: A complexly nuanced Kona-grown Red Bourbon, rife with sweet fruit and floral notes supported by undertones of rich sandalwood.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Koke
review: An elegant natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup, complex with rich fruit and chocolate throughout.

name: Ka’u Oro Yeast Typica
review: Innovative practices during the ferment step of fruit removal appear to have encouraged intensified aromatic originality and depth in this traditional Big Island Typica. Floral, richly herb-toned, deeply sweet.

name: Gedeb Yirgacheffe Ethiopia
review: A dynamic Ethiopia cup with high-toned fruit notes and bittersweet florals, all enveloped in crisp cocoa.

name: DR Congo FTO Bourbon SOPACDI
review: One of the finest Congos we've cupped in years: spice-toned, floral, tantalizingly sweet-savory, with a throughline of rich earth tones evoking a forest walk after a rain.

name: Mahonda Burundi
review: A chocolaty Burundi coffee with richly crisp notes of dried mulberry and an especially appealing acidity, bright and juicy.

name: Signature Hazelnut Dark Chocolate
review: A lively espresso blend: chocolaty and floral-toned, especially in milk.

name: Signature Floral Orange
review: A subtly fruit-forward espresso blend, balanced by inviting chocolate suggestions and invigorating notes of citrus zest.

name: El Salvador
review: A classic Pacamara cup that finesses the sweet-savory paradox: simultaneous sweet fruit and floral impulses coupled with umami depth and intrigue.

name: Kiniyota Espresso
review: A confident and expressive coffee from Burundi, roasted for espresso applications, with rich notes of stone fruit and dark chocolate enlivened by flowers suggesting spice-toned star jasmine.

name: Guardian Spirit Espresso Blend
review: An espresso blend with strong character, particularly expressed in the bittersweet, tart-leaning milk shot, deepened by notes of dark chocolate.

name: Kenya Nyeri Rumukia Peaberry
review: A rich, discreetly roast-toned Kenya cup, with notes of black currant and chocolate as throughlines.

name: Kenya Nyeri Karuthi AA
review: A pleasing, light-footed and accessible Kenya cup: crisp, citrusy, sweetly wood-framed.

name: El Obraje Geisha
review: An exciting Colombia Gesha cup that covers all the aromatic and gustatory bases: spicy florals notes, sweetly savory earth tones, umami sensations and rich sweetness throughout.

name: Burundi
review: A sweet-toned, approachable Burundi coffee, with inviting notes of vanilla and date at its heart.

name: Mirador Colombia
review: A sweetly tart, juicy Colombia cup animated by sweet floral and citrus notes throughout.

name: Kenya Kirinyaga Mukangu AB
review: A classic Kenya coffee with a rich balance of sweet and savory tones brightened by a crisp, juicy acidity.

name: Brazil Carmo de Minas Natural
review: A crisply fruit-toned, lightly fermenty natural-processed Brazil cup.

name: Brazil Pulped Natural
review: A deeply sweet pulped natural coffee with a throughline of spicy floral notes supported by cacao nib and buttery cashew.

name: Minas Gerais Isaias Ferreira No. 2
review: A classic Brazil cup in its presentation of deeply sweet notes of dark chocolate, nut and raisiny fruit.

name: Brasil Ipanema Premier Cru Gold B69 Natural
review: A graceful, light-footed cup, understated and refined.

name: Brazil Fazenda São Bento
review: A subtle but seductive cup, juicy, savory-sweet, with a pleasing range of aromatics: lavender, orange, cocoa.

name: Fazenda Recreio Bourbon Pulped Natural
review: Gently but resonantly expressive and complex. For those who prefer subtle intricacy and depth to bold assertion.

name: Brazil Ouro de Minas Pulped Natural
review: A classic pulped-natural Brazil, delicate yet resonant, lightly floral, cedary, nut-toned.

name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Adado Shara
review: The “natural” or dried-in-the fruit processing develops an impressively light-footed yet cleanly lush version of the flowers, cocoa and fruit character of this fine Yirgacheffe.

name: No. 7 Espresso Blend
review: A roast-toned, sweet-savory espresso blend with rich floral and deep umami impulses.

name: Kenya Embu Uteuzi Jimbo
review: A deeply sweet Kenya with classic red fruit notes and added intrigue from tangy tamarind and a citrusy floral akin to lantana.

name: Sumatra Batak Naga Saribu
review: A complex, harmonious Sumatra cup, with sweetly tart fruit and deeply sweet floral notes enveloped in rich earthiness.

name: Replay Espresso
review: A great value for a richly sweet, floral and crisply citrusy espresso blend.

name: Burundi Gaharo Hill Long Miles Coffee Project Natural
review: A deeply sweet Burundi cup with a savory richness typical of Central Africa coffees and a throughline of pleasing herbaceousness.

name: Kiniyota Burundi
review: A richly sweet Burundi cup, with spicy floral tones and a savory note suggesting cumin; subtle and inviting.

name: Burundi Gahahe Washing Station Microlot Honey
review: A sweet, crisp, balanced Burundi cup, especially appealing in its quietly intriguing aromatics.

name: Rwanda Cyato
review: A richly sweet cup with the intrigue of savory herb notes throughout.

name: Rwanda Hingakawa Women’s Co-op Fair Trade
review: A citrusy, sweet-toned Rwanda cup with inviting notes of rich toffee.

name: Uganda Kapchorwa

review: A distinctive wet-processed Ethiopia cup with resonant stone fruit and crisp chocolate notes throughout.

name: Nano Challa Ethiopia
review: A pretty Ethiopia coffee characterized by tropical fruit and spice-toned flowers.

name: Kenya AB
review: A deeply sweet Kenya cup with a developed roast profile that equally prioritizes flowers and chocolate.

name: Ethiopia Hambela Natural Organic
review: A spice-driven, fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia cup: rich, resonant, clean, deep.

name: Tanzania Ngorongoro Ridge Peaberry
review: A lush Tanzania cup laden with red fruit and deep chocolate tones throughout, lifted by a bright acidity.

name: Ecuador Los Eucaliptos
review: An entertaining Ecuador coffee with an unusual profile that pleasingly suggests root beer, punctuated by bright herb and sweet-toned spice notes.

name: Ecuador Pichincha Typica
review: An elegant, balanced Ecuador cup saturated with notes of tropical fruit and spicy flowers.

name: Ecuador Finca Carolina Fausto Romo
review: An impressive Ecuador cup: big, resonant, layered with sweet stone fruit and rich nut tones.

name: Geisha Pasco Oxapampa Peru
review: An ultra-sweet Peru Geisha cup resonating rich floral and deep nut tones throughout.

name: Finca Tasta Peru
review: A cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed Peru cup, ringing with spicy floral and rich aromatic wood notes.

name: Peru La Salina
review: A nuanced Peru coffee characterized by red fruit notes, rich aromatic wood, and a throughline of sweet musk-like notes.

name: Bolivia Yungas Caranavi Finca Las Alasitas Peaberry
review: A graceful natural-processed Geisha cup, understated and elegant in its clean fruit and deep cocoa notes.

name: Ethiopia Hambela Alaka
review: A balanced, classic Ethiopia wet-processed cup: cocoa- and citrus-toned with sweet florals throughout.

name: 100% Kona Bourbon
review: An inviting cup from the classic Bourbon variety as grown in Kona, complex and sweet-savory.

name: Kona Naturals
review: A fruit-driven natural-processed Kona Typica cup with a pleasing hint of grappa-like sweet ferment.

name: Rwanda Rulindo Tumba
review: A rich, pleasing Rwanda coffee with berry notes, vanilla-like florals, and an appealing hint of sweet herbs.

name: Guatemala Quejina
review: A citrus-driven, quite bright Guatemala cup with a pretty floral note akin to candied violet.

name: Flight Seasonal Espresso
review: An espresso blend creatively comprised of both washed- and natural-processed coffees, the former bringing bright florals to the cup, the latter, deep fruit.

name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Black Honey
review: A crisp, richly sweet, berry-driven black honey from Costa Rica.

name: Eaagads Estate Kenya
review: A beautiful Kenya cup with layers of intrigue, from the classic cocoa-toned currant note to the pleasing twist of sweetly savory herbs.

name: Ethiopia Guji
review: An aromatically saturated, flavor-deep cup that hits all of the classic Ethiopia notes: fruit, florals, cocoa and aromatic wood.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1
review: A pretty, floral-toned Ethiopia cup with particularly vibrant acidity and plush mouthfeel.

name: Kenya Karindundu AA Small Lot Reserve
review: A perfectly structured coffee alive with aromatic intrigue. It gave us far too many positive descriptors to list. Just a few more: dried mulberry, blood orange zest, raw honey.

name: Sumatra Aceh Gayo Mountain Kenawat Raisin Honey
review: An unusual honey-processed coffee from Sumatra: graceful, balanced, quietly original.

name: Ketiara Sumatra
review: Attractive choice for lovers of the traditional Sumatra wet-hulled profile: earthy, pungent, yet bright, offering bonus satisfaction for supporters of progressive, women-led cooperatives.

name: Sumatra Lintong
review: Bright and vivacious, yet resonantly deep: a Sumatra for all seasons.

name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Hambela G1 Bishan Fugu
review: A rich-toned, resonant, cleanly fruity natural-processed Ethiopia cup with delicate florals and sweet musky notes throughout.

name: Tanzania Tarime AB
review: A high-toned yet deeply savory Tanzania cup with resonant stone fruit and spicy floral notes throughout.

name: El Salvador Cerro Las Ranas Honey Espresso
review: A deeply sweet, chocolaty and spice-toned El Salvador, adeptly roasted for espresso.

name: Blossom Single Origin Espresso
review: A light-footed, exhilaratingly bright and juicy espresso, complex as both straight shot and in short milk.

name: Panama Baru Geisha Black
review: An intentionally ferment-toned Geisha cup with exquisite balance: notes of passionfruit on the sweet end of the spectrum and hops on the savory, with dark chocolate running through the whole.

name: Kenya Safari AB Top
review: Superb and classic Kenya, intense in structure, layered and resonantly intricate in aroma and flavor.

name: No. 79 Blend Espresso
review: A balanced, expressive espresso blend with dessert-like aroma and flavor notes.

name: Brazil Para Ela Natural
review: A beautiful berry-centric natural-processed coffee from Brazil, with especially high-toned acidity and deep cocoa notes throughout.

name: Tumba Rwanda
review: An attractively savory-leaning Rwanda cup whose leading descriptor is sweet squash; this unusual but pleasing note is supported by sweet herb and spicy floral suggestions, rounded by a rich cocoa.

name: Ethiopia Harrar
review: Crisp, chocolaty, roast-toned cup, with a zesty edge.

name: KonAroma Direct Trade Kona
review: A plush, smooth roast-touched Kona.

name: Peru Chirinois
review: A beautifully balanced Peru cup: fruit, flowers and nuts in crisply sweet harmony.

name: Ecuador Finca La Papaya
review: A solid Ecuador cup, balanced and friendly, with appealing cocoa notes throughout.

name: Peru Natural Utcubamba
review: A natural-processed Peru cup with an appealing hint of cordial-like sweet ferment animating a layering of fruit, floral and tobacco notes.

name: Kenya Murang’a Githiga AA
review: Though delicate and perhaps a bit bright for some palates, the integrated breadth of “tart” is reminiscent of fine desserts by the same name. An elegant example of the Kenya type.

name: Borneo Sabah Arabica
review: The first coffee from Malaysian Borneo to be roasted for retail consumers in the U.S. and a promising new project in a region not yet known for specialty coffee.

name: Colombia
review: A quietly seductive Colombia, organized around a pleasingly sweet chocolate note.

name: D.R. Congo Muungano Co-Op
review: Deep, resonant and pleasing. Dry, yet quite plump and juicy.

name: No. 6 Espresso Blend
review: A roast-toned, richly bittersweet espresso with prominent chocolate character and sweet floral nuance.

name: Ethiopia Sidama Shantewene
review: A clean, bright natural Sidamo cup: high-toned fruit, deep musk notes, bittersweet complexity.

name: Kivu Belt Lot 32 Espresso
review: An impressively integrated Rwanda espresso, equally sweet and savory. Especially pleasing in milk, where chocolate and tamarind suggestions contribute to a bright, expressive cappuccino.

name: Kivu Belt Lot 32 Rwanda
review: A classic Rwanda cup: deeply sweet yet resonant with savory intrigue. Think cocoa-toned baking spices.

name: Gesha Rebecca Natural
review: A superbly structured natural-processed Ethiopia Gesha that leads with clean fruit tones supported by rich cocoa and deep florals.

name: Bufcafe Rwanda
review: A quiet coffee with a very distinct savory sweetness. Those who avoid assertively bright coffees may enjoy its restraint.

name: Café Granja La Esperanza Sudan Rume Natural
review: A shape-shifter of a coffee: brilliant, original, absorbing.

name: La Papaya Ecuador
review: An aromatically bright and rousing Typica cup, high-toned with bittersweet citrus and rich spice notes.

name: Aponte Colombia
review: An attractive composite of tart and savory elements and an exciting coffee, given the historic limitations on processing in Colombia.

name: Sumatra Tano Batak
review: Classic Sumatra genius: chocolate and earth, sweet-savory berry, balanced and complete.

name: Boru Batak Sumatra
review: Fine traditional Sumatra, lightly plump and juicy in mouthfeel, aromatically driven by earth-nuanced pungent fruit and dry chocolate.

name: Sumatra Gayo King Mandheling
review: Snacking after some work in the garden. The scent of fresh-turned earth and dark chocolate.

name: Huta Raja Natural
review: An impressively clean, crisp, cocoa-toned (and atypical) natural-processed coffee from Sumatra.

name: Sumatra Pantan Musara
review: For lovers of depth and sweet-savory resonance — those who enjoy the roundly sweet/tart/savory character of a fine ripe tomato, for example.

name: ASOPCAFA Colombia
review: Crisp, briskly dry yet sweet; delicately chocolate- and nut-toned.

name: Natural Burundi Nemba
review: A quietly original coffee: big-bodied, low-toned, crisply sweet-savory.

name: Ka’u Champagne Natural
review: Adventures in wine yeast: Two of Hawai’i’s (and the world’s) most common coffee varieties are elevated by an experimental fermentation method that results in a beverage that evokes Champagne — fruity but dry, not effervescent, but exceptionally vibrant.

name: Monarch Gesha
review: A deep, nuanced Gesha, excitingly original with high-toned herb notes, low-toned, almost candy-sweet fruit, and rich, spice-toned florals.

name: Puna Barrel-Aged
review: A fascinating sensory experience of a coffee aged in rum barrels: a recombinant mashup of musky fruit notes, sweet ferment, spicy florals, and chocolate with a salty edge.

name: Kona Peaberry
review: The classically delicate, subtle Kona Typica profile is enhanced by the careful medium roast, as well as by the selection of peaberries only.

name: Laura’s Reserve SL-28
review: A classic SL-28 cup, juicy-sweet with leading notes of red fruit and spice-toned sweet florals, supported by suggestions of buttery toffee.

name: Ka’u Natural
review: An engaging natural-processed Ka’u coffee, fruit-driven, with a foundation of pipe tobacco and cocoa notes.

name: Maui Kupa’a Orange Bourbon
review: A window into the great potential of higher-grown, cool-climate Maui coffee: bright but balanced, sweet-toned, and subtly nuanced. Grown in Kula, an agricultural zone on the western-facing slopes of Mount Haleakala and source of most of the island’s locally grown fruits and vegetables.

name: Honey Typica
review: Richly floral and cleanly fruit-toned, an impressive and increasingly familiar style of natural- and honey-processed coffee from Ka’u producers.

name: Ka’u Typica Natural
review: The fruit typical of a natural-processed coffee is pleasingly balanced here by deep nougat, citrus zest, and rich aromatic wood notes.

name: Estate-Grown Mamo
review: An opportunity to taste one of the world’s rarest coffees, a hybrid that exemplifies the persistence and ingenuity of coffee scientists.

name: Colombia Las Joyas: Fidencio Martinez Lot
review: An attractively tart and savory honey-processed coffee. Try it with salty morning dishes, which should develop its subtle, complementary sweetness.

name: Colombia Tolima Monteverde Estate Natural Wush Wush
review: An extraordinary coffee, difficult to characterize in typical coffee language, yet deeply satisfying, ringing with quiet, resonant authority.

name: Ethiopia Oromia Guji Washed
review: A deep, satisfying coffee, accessible yet resonantly complex.

name: Yemen Matari
review: A complex and engaging rendition of the characteristically richly spicy, tobacco-toned, floral-fruity Yemen profile.

name: Crema de Dolce Espresso
review: A rich-toned straight shot, and an inviting espresso in milk: resonant and familiar in its harmonious bittersweetness.

name: Espresso Classico
review: A “classic” espresso in the old-school Italian style. Perhaps the addition of quality-sourced Robusta coffee gives the blend a throwback Italian vibe.

name: Ace Espresso
review: Propeller’s Ace Espresso Blend comprises an ever-evolving series of components that seem to always hit the mark; this version is bright, sweetly tart, and singingly confident.

name: Old Crow Cuppa Joe
review: Suggests classic in its fusion of fruit and chocolate, but the inclusion of a natural-processed Central America coffee in the blend adds a newer-style, high-toned fruit note that is especially pretty in milk.

name: Ethiopia Sidamo Sasaba
review: A balanced, friendly natural-processed Ethiopia cup characterized by cocoa-toned stone fruit and delicate florals.

name: Zambia Kateshi Natural Process
review: A good choice for lovers of natural-processed coffees who prefer to avoid even a hint of sweet ferment; this cup is all clean fruit and florals.

name: Ethiopia Gedeb Worka Sakaro
review: A vibrant, high-toned washed-processed Ethiopia cup with rich floral and citrus tones throughout, all enveloped in dark chocolate.

name: La Belleza Colombia
review: An intriguing Colombia cup with deep savory-sweetness, top notes of elegant flowers and undertones of earthy-sweet pipe tobacco.

name: Colombia Pink Bourbon
review: A beautiful fruit- and floral-toned Colombia cup with undertones of rich chocolate and resonant sandalwood.

name: Crystalina
review: A lush, high-toned natural Colombia cup, as clean and bright as its name implies.

name: Kenya Kiambu Gititu AA
review: A classic Kenya cup: bright, balanced, sweetly savory and deeply vibrant throughout.

name: Hawaiian Kona 100%
review: A pretty, richly fruit-toned natural-processed Kona cup, organic-certified.

name: Guatemala Finca El General BlackLand Lot
review: A friendly, cocoa- and nut-toned Guatemala espresso, both as straight shot and in cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Ninety Plus Gesha Estates JBC Custom Lot #252
review: A coffee that in its wild, unruly intensity and intriguing aromatic drama challenges the boundaries of what coffee is and can be.

name: La Palma Y El Tucan Hero Series Colombia Sidra Lot #190
review: A uniquely compelling coffee that is, at turns, spicy, floral, chocolaty and fruit-toned, yet in the end harmonious and complete.

name: Suyusama Colombia
review: A deeply rich Colombia coffee with equal parts sweet (chocolate, flowers, fruit) and savory (hop flowers): balanced and inviting.

name: ASOPCAFA Espresso
review: A balanced, poised espresso in the newer, brighter style.

name: Rukera Espresso
review: An espresso whose expression in the straight shot is classic Kenya in a dance of vibrant sweet and savory and shimmering aromatic complexity; in milk, it’s an almost addictive fine dessert with an umami edge.

name: Colombia Pink Bourbon El Corazon
review: A floral- and spice-toned cup: balanced, complex, multilayered.

name: L2 Love Espresso Blend
review: A Kenya espresso blend, through and through, with the hallmark brightness and savory edge associated with this origin’s classically sweet-tart structure.

name: Guatemala-Ethiopia Espresso Blend
review: A “classic” third-wave espresso that presents bittersweet citrus, rich floral and lemony herb notes, all rounded by chocolate throughout.

name: Black Meow Blend
review: Suggests traditional Italian-style espresso, bittersweet and accessible, with especially pretty chocolate notes.

name: Karibu Espresso Blend
review: An unusual espresso blend, sweet and tart, with intriguing spice notes suggesting cardamom.

name: Sun Sun Sun Sun Sun Sun Sun Sun Sun Blend
review: An avant-garde espresso blend of nine different natural-processed coffees — ideal for the lover of unabashedly fruit-toned coffees.

name: Ethiopia Hambela 1 Organic Natural Alaka
review: A pleasing Ethiopia natural: balanced, accessible, sweetly fruit-forward.

name: Brazil Ibicoara Chapada Diamantina Natural
review: A solid Brazil natural: clean, deeply sweet, with a pleasing savory throughline.

name: Costa Rica Coto Brus-La Amistad
review: A friendly, easy-drinking Costa Rica cup, lively with citrusy herb notes and sweet florals.

name: Karimikui AA Kenya
review: A big, richly, authoritative sweet-savory Kenya, lifted and animated by shimmers of flowers and tart citrus.

name: Peru Antonio Regalado Diaz El Huyacan La Palma
review: An inviting coffee from Peru, characterized by deep florals and balanced by notes of stone fruit and citrus zest.

name: Bella Carmona Guatemala
review: Sweet and savory in equal measure, with a tart throughline: complex, nuanced, and multilayered.

name: Peru Natural Jose Herrera Lot 21
review: A heady coffee with clean, confident fruit notes throughout, supported by deep chocolate and spice-toned florals.

name: Burundi Dukorerikawa Natural
review: An attractively bright and fruit-centered coffee with unique and inviting savory elements.

name: Guatemala Acatenango Washed Lot 503 Espresso
review: A satisfying Guatemala espresso: balanced, with notes of stone fruit and cocoa. Especially attractive in the milk shot.

name: The Core Espresso
review: A masterful blend of coffees from four different coffee-producing countries that nets a vibrant, engaging shot and a rich, decadent cappuccino.

name: Espresso Mandarina
review: A juicy, balanced espresso blend, both in the straight shot—where berry notes predominate—and in milk—where chocolate frames the fruit and florals.

name: SOB Espresso
review: An unusually successful “melange” coffee in which the same blend of green beans is roasted both darker and lighter, then combined. This version hits all of the notes associated with a complete, classic espresso: rich, resounding, chocolaty, floral and fruit-toned.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Chelelektu Natural
review: A complex, nuanced expression of a natural-processed Yirgacheffe coffee: fruit-forward, balanced, juicy and multi-layered — the fruit-centered genius of a natural conveyed with the completeness and inevitability of a classic.

name: Kenya Kimaruri
review: A classic Kenya cup: sweet, tart, juicy all wrapped together with deep-toned red fruit and spicy floral notes.

name: Zambia Kateshi Natural
review: A pretty, fruit-prominent natural-processed coffee expressing balance and finesse.

name: Kenya Handege
review: Rather than the typical Kenya black currant and cocoa profile, this equally remarkable Kenya is driven by the intensity of the musky/rich elements and the juicy stone fruit and citrus.

name: Kauai Estate Reserve Sun-Dried Typica
review: Quiet, round, crisply balanced, with sweet stone fruit and cocoa supported by savory-leaning nut and oak.

name: Ecuador Loja Clara Sidra Natural Taza Dorada #2
review: A sweetly bright yet roundly savory rendition of the rare Sidra varietal.

name: The Natural
review: A compelling natural espresso — fully loaded with chocolaty, fruit-forward adventure.

name: Ethiopia Sidamo G4 Natural Espresso
review: A thoroughly enjoyable fruit-forward espresso with considerable complexity, expressed by the roaster through the romantic notion written on the retail bag, “The road to love is very happy, Blowing the horn at 3pm.”

name: Green-Tip Geisha
review: An impressive example of Mexico-grown Geisha: elegant, delicate, nuanced, and deeply engaging.

name: Saint Helena Island Peaberry
review: An extremely rare, limited-production coffee procured by Miguel Meza of Paradise Roasters, well worth sampling for its balanced, pleasingly complex cup profile.

name: Philippines Sitio Naguey Natural
review: A rare opportunity to sample a fine specialty coffee emerging valiantly from a neglected coffee-growing region where 90 percent of coffee grown is of the Robusta species and almost all is consumed locally.

name: Ethiopia Guji Queen Honey
review: Deep, floral and cleanly fruit-toned, with prominent notes of dried stone fruit, spicy florals, and rich aromatic wood.

name: Ethiopia Civet Sidama Papilio Natural
review: A sweet-toned natural Ethiopia cup that supplements ripe berry notes and dark chocolate with inviting hints of rich sandalwood.

name: Banco Gotete Ethiopia
review: Fragrant jasmine and pungent incense-like notes in distinguish this crisply graceful wet-processed Ethiopia.

name: Ethiopia Washed Guji Dimtu Espresso
review: A fine darker-roasted espresso; the aromatic roast notes are saturated with Ethiopia chocolate and flowers. Especially attractive in the milk shot.

name: Barichu Double
review: A mesmerizing Kenya that is equally balanced among sweet, tart and savory impulses, with a particularly lively acidity.

name: GA 400 Espresso
review: A creative blend of washed and natural-processed coffees that complement each other with primary notes of both chocolate and fruit, both in the straight shot and in milk.

name: Papua New Guinea Timuza
review: A friendly, engaging PNG cup with leading notes of deep florals supported by sweet nut tones throughout the profile.

name: Rukera Kenya
review: One of the most striking coffees we’ve tested this year: levitatingly vibrant, profoundly integrated, with savory and sweet in deep harmony — and, paradoxically, both classic and original in its expression of the great Kenya style.

name: Trilogy
review: A blend of washed and wet-hulled coffees that reads like a friendly Sumatra: sweetly wood-framed with notes of chocolate and baking spices.

name: Kenya Kiambu Uklili AA
review: A harmonious, lyrical, balanced Kenya coffee, classic in its expression of both sweet and savory impulses.

name: Ethiopia Guji Shakisso Natural Lot 24
review: An elegant natural-processed Ethiopia that is fruit-forward without a hint of ferment: crisp, clean, juicy-sweet.

name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe Nafasha Lot
review: An integrated, citrus-inflected washed Ethiopia cup with a cocoa throughline and spicy floral notes, particularly in the aroma.

name: La Avila SL28 El Salvador
review: The nut notes are pleasant but just a front; drink it for its grown-up dry chocolate, zesty lime and elderflower notes that emerge with just a little patience.

name: El Salvador
review: Balanced and comprehensive in structure, with a subtle but grand array of aromatics: honey-like flowers, crisp lavender-like flowers, juicy yet savory fruit (we called it roasted pineapple), nut, dry chocolate.

name: Talquezalar El Salvador
review: Both delicate and resonant, animated by sweet, honeyish nut and lime-toned citrus.

name: Finca Kilimanjaro Natural
review: A nut-toned bitter-savory inclination is lifted majestically by a deep, cherry-like sweetness. Drink it for the contrast, and the big, syrupy mouthfeel.

name: Finca San Antonio El Salvador
review: A quietly original Geisha: sweet-savory, complexly aromatic.

name: Mario Aguilar Grand Cru El Salvador
review: Cedary dark chocolate and subtle walnut and peach notes make this a particularly accessible version of the great Pacamara profile.

name: José Flores El Salvador Natural
review: Almost two coffees, one dominated by a bracing bitter-leaning structure, the other sweet and complexly aromatic. Enjoy it for its paradox and its particularly syrupy mouthfeel.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Worka Gotiti Natural
review: A sweetly fermenty natural-processed Ethiopia turned slightly more austere by bittersweet floral and spicy aromatic wood notes.

name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain Natural
review: Lovely Ethiopia natural: cleanly fruit-toned, crisp, resonant, and sweet through and through.

name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Blue Donkey Lot
review: A juicy, rich natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup with clean fruit and cocoa tones throughout and an appealing savory edge.

name: Guatemala Guayabales Single-Origin Espresso
review: A single-origin espresso from Guatemala pleasingly floral-prominent in both the straight shot and with milk. Rich, crisp, high-toned.

name: Kenya Chania Estate
review: A pleasing umami-driven Kenya that foreground notes of sweet, ripe tomato with enveloped in rich florals and crisp chocolate.

name: Guatemala Los Santos
review: A richly bittersweet Guatemala cup punctuated by pretty notes of citrus zest throughout.

name: Geisha Village Auction Lot #11
review: Exhilarating, bright, balmy: like drinking a spring day with a cocoa chaser.

name: Panama Finca Kalithea Natural Geisha
review: An exquisitely balanced natural-processed Geisha with the deep, sweet complexity the type can offer without a hint of ferment: crisply sweet fruit top and bottom notes, along with rich florals and chocolate tones in the mid-palate, all enhanced by a whisper of sandalwood.

name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Super Mario 6 Geisha
review: Extravagant florals and spice-toned cocoa notes characterize this deeply sweet, washed-processed Panama cup with a nuanced yet omnipresent umami impulse.

name: Panama Geisha Alto Jaramillo
review: An impressively smooth, coherent structure supports a quietly pleasing set of Geisha aromatics. Should satisfy those who may find the full-on Panama Geisha fireworks a bit much but who still enjoy the distinctive character of this rare variety.

name: Colombia Laderas del Tapias Estate Natural Geisha
review: A deep berry-toned cup with a juicy hint of sweet ferment and rich cocoa notes throughout.

name: Gesha Village Natural Lot #19
review: A beautifully structured natural-processed Ethiopia Gesha, with striking sweetness pleasingly complicated by notes of aromatic resin and tropical fruit.

name: Gesha Village 1931 Lot 27
review: A pleasingly coherent coffee that is both sweet and savory in harmonious balance, with floral and fruit tones throughout and an herbaceous note that grounds and enriches the whole.

name: Ethiopia Sidamo Gora Kone
review: A delicately complex and nuanced coffee, subtly composed around fruit and musky floral tones.

name: Classic Nine Espresso
review: An interpretation of classic espresso, with rich, smoky-toned chocolate alongside sweet fruit. Particularly pleasing in three parts milk.

name: Kebele Village Espresso
review: A lovely espresso whose tartness is integrated with a deep and embracing sweetness.

name: Kebele Village Ethiopia
review: A coffee for those who like their washed Ethiopias high-toned and tart-leaning, with an abiding cocoa- and floral-toned sweetness throughout.

name: D31 The New Life
review: An undeniably powerful espresso, and an interesting and engaging interpretation of the ancient Mocha-Java blend concept, combining fruit and flowers from an Ethiopia/Yemen coffee with rich spice and sweet depth from an Indonesia.

name: Panama Finca San Sebastian
review: A resonant expression of the traditional Panama washed cup, driven by deep chocolate notes supported by subtle but persistent sweet floral tones. A bargain at $12 for 12 ounces.

name: Rwanda Nyarusiza Station
review: A sweet, pleasingly floral coffee animated by berry and cocoa notes throughout.

name: Murang’a Kenya
review: A big-bodied Kenya, zesty, deep, yet delicately layered in the aromatics.

name: Murang’a Kenya Espresso
review: A bold sweet-savory espresso with a striking and original range of aromatics.

name: Coffea Diversa Cioiccie
review: An extremely rare, limited-production coffee procured by Miguel Meza of Paradise Roasters, unique in both backstory and cup.

name: Yirgacheffe Gedeb G1 Natural
review: A complex, umami- and citrus-driven natural-processed Ethiopia cup that hits all the pleasure spots: sweet, tart and savory in harmonious balance.

name: Guatemala San Cristobal
review: A crisp, sweetly herbaceous and citrusy Guatemala cup with warming spice tones throughout.

name: Peru Paltachayoc
review: A gently roasty cup redolent of chocolate and deep, spice-toned florals.

name: Ethiopia Sidama Naia Bomb Natural Vertical Reserve
review: A natural-processed Ethiopia ideal for those who enjoy a restrained hint of fruit ferment, in this case suggesting a just-emptied wine barrel in a cool cellar.

name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga
review: A washed-process Ethiopia cup with leading notes of stone fruit and spicy florals and an especially inviting texture.

name: Kenya Gakundu FCS Kamviu Wet Mill
review: A savory-leaning yet deeply sweet Kenya coffee with the distinct red and black currant notes characteristic of the origin, bittersweet florals and a lively citrus.

name: TMC SB Blend Espresso
review: A nut- and chocolate-toned espresso blend, quite dark-roasted, that displays particularly nicely in cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Nayo Ovalle Guatemala
review: A balanced, sweetly nut-driven cup with pretty notes of baker’s chocolate and hints of oak forest that linger into the finish.

name: Gesha Village Lot #85 Natural
review: An exquisitely clean natural-processed Gesha cup from Ethiopia, elegantly structured and confidently aromatic.

name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Banko Gotiti
review: An enticing natural-processed Ethiopia with big fruit notes supported by deep chocolate, rich aromatic wood and impressive spice-toned florals.

name: Guatemala Washed Finca El General Pache M-Plus Espresso
review: A rich-toned, floral-driven espresso, particularly expressive in cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Guatemala Washed Finca El General Pache
review: A friendly, accessible Guatemala cup: crispy sweet with nut and chocolate throughlines.

name: Guatemala Washed Finca El General Lot Summer End Espresso
review: An accessible espresso, medium-roasted and balanced, with pleasing chocolate, fruit and floral notes in both straight shot and milk.

name: Colombia La Esperanza Natural XO
review: A clean natural-processed Colombia cup from an unusual variety of Arabica — fruit-driven and chocolaty.

name: Indonesia Sumatra Gayo Espresso
review: Roast-prominent yet thoroughly integrated, this espresso offers a compelling sweet-savory depth for those who enjoy the style.

name: Ethiopia Limu Nano Challa Lot #10
review: A classic washed Ethiopia cup: high-toned, rich and juicy, with notes of stone fruit and flowers throughout.

name: Geisha XO
review: A cleanly and thoroughly berry-toned natural-processed Geisha with big chocolate notes throughout and satisfying savory underpinnings.

name: Colombia Finca La Maria Geisha Natural
review: An unabashedly fruit-centered natural-processed Geisha with big florals to match the fruit and compelling, subtle spice undertones.

name: Cordillera del Fuego Costa Rica Anaerobic
review: An anaerobic-processed coffee whose startling originality leans toward musk, chocolate and cinnamon.

name: Ethiopia Anaerobic
review: Drink it for its original yet subtly expressed embodiment of the peculiarly intriguingly sweet-tart genius of anaerobic or lactic acid fermentation.

name: Costa Rica Anaerobic
review: The complex, sweet-spicy character of Mexican chocolate dominates in this shifting, surprising, but ultimately balanced cup.

name: Colombia Finca El Paraiso Double Anaerobic Geisha
review: The startling aromatic surprises of the Geisha variety are overlaid and intensified by the less familiar surprises of an experimental lactic-acid-inducing fermentation step. For those who pursue the rare and remarkable in beverages.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Adorsi
review: Drink it for its originality and paradox: Sweet, musky and perfumy yet crisp and bracingly brisk.

name: Ethiopia Sidama Naia Bombe Dry Ferment Vertical Reserve
review: A processing variation (fermentation without added water) perhaps contributes to the deep, savory-sweet floral-toned intrigue of this fine washed-process Ethiopia.

name: Colombia Monteblanco Gesha Cold Fermentation
review: Deeply sweet in structure with savory undertones and intriguing, original aromatics centered on brisk, bittersweet flowers.

name: Costa Rica Brunca Finca Vista Passion Honey
review: A sweet but brisk cup saturated by a seductive sweet chocolate and a lively lime-like citrus.

name: Estate Grade House Blend Espresso
review: A bold, chocolaty espresso with a floral throughline that is especially rich-toned in cappucino-scaled milk.

name: Chania Kenya
review: Drink it if you like a nuanced but bright, sweet-tart cup in the traditional style.

name: Kenya Kibirigwi Thunguri
review: A big, juicy, and crisply sweet Kenya cup, with compelling savory undertones and a cocoa throughline.

name: Washed Kenya
review: A powerful and engaging cup, paradoxical in its combination of roasty-savory depth and tart, floral-toned intensity.

name: Coffea Diversa Bourbon Rey Jamaica
review: A multi-layered Jamaica coffee with distinct chocolate and spicy floral tones and a throughline of dried fruit reminiscent of fig.

name: Coffea Diversa Bourbon Rey Guatemala
review: An elegant, inviting Guatemala cup with a particularly impressive structure, balanced yet buoyant and lively.

name: Colombia Huila
review: An intensely bright coffee with attractive, savory-leaning undertones.

name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Super Mario Geisha
review: A levitatingly sweet and juicy coffee, an extravaganza of fruit and flowers with deep chocolate throughout — pure, yet lavish.

name: Tablon La Cima
review: A friendly, accessible cocoa- and nut-toned El Salvador cup.

name: Nicaragua Finca Idealista
review: A high-toned Nicaragua cup showing a range of stone fruit, cocoa, and sweet nut in harmonious balance.

name: Ethiopia Guji Gerbicho Natural
review: A fruit-forward natural processed Ethiopia cup with ballast from rich cocoa and floral suggestions throughout the profile.

name: Panama Elida Natural Catuai
review: An explosively sweet, fruit-forward natural-processed coffee produced by the same farm that gave us the latest price-record-breaking, most sought-after Geisha in the world. Consider this coffee a worthy and affordable cousin.

name: Cate Natural G5
review: An exceptionally balanced and cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia with distinct berry and chocolate tones and a particularly syrupy mouthfeel.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe GR1 Bedhatu Jibicho Washed
review: A balanced, crisply herb-toned washed Yirgacheffe cup deepened by sweet stonefruit notes.

name: Kenya Nyeri Othaya Gura AA
review: A balanced, cocoa-driven Kenya cup with classic currant notes and rich florals throughout.

name: Signature Blend
review: A straightforward, accessible blend that mirrors the fast-casual restaurant setting in which it’s served.

name: Ethiopia Konga Natural
review: A rich-toned Yirgacheffe whose processing method (natural) highlights the cup’s fruit-forward qualities.

name: Kenya Ndaroini
review: A medium-roasted Kenya that highlights the coffee’s chocolate tendencies, with lively, high-toned acidity.

name: Harimau Tiger Sumatra
review: An alluring Sumatra cup, both classic and innovative: sweetly earth-framed (classic) but profoundly high-toned (innovative) with nuanced complexity.

name: Gachami Kenya
review: A classic Kenya cup with bright, juicy fruit and lively sweet-tart acidity.

name: Twisted V.5
review: A bright and vibrantly rich contemporary-style espresso with an appealing depth of character.

name: Finca Santa Isabel Guatemala
review: A straightforward, deeply sweet, cocoa-laden Guatemala cup.

name: Ethiopia Natural “Phoenix”
review: A bright, cleanly fruit-toned Ethiopia espresso with big florals balanced by spice suggestions; especially pretty mouthfeel.

name: Costa Rica SL-28 Yellow Honey Espresso
review: The intense roast character will please some and turn off others, but regardless, a thoroughly engaging, complex cup with great levity and sweetness.

name: Burundi Washed “Crystal”
review: A pleasingly tart, invigorating espresso with attractive floral and dry chocolate notes, perhaps best enjoyed as a straight shot or short Americano.

name: Ethiopia Natural Gedeb Violent Andromeda
review: Very sweet and chocolaty, with pungent florals; especially attractive in cappuccino-scaled milk.

name: Espresso Blend Classic No. 1
review: A fine Indonesia/El Salvador espresso blend that is both chocolate-driven and exceptionally floral.

name: Ethiopia Hambela Natural
review: A friendly, accessible Ethiopia cup animated by pleasing berry and spicy floral notes.

name: Panama Perci Geisha Natural
review: A lush, juicy, tropical natural-processed profile overlaid on a deep, spicy/savory profile with something else as well, an edge we might associate with fermented foods like yogurt or pickles. Clearly for coffee adventurers.

name: Cordillera del Fuego Costa Rica Anaerobic
review: A high-toned, cleanly fruit-forward Costa Rica cup with deeply rich savory underpinnings.

name: Kenya Kiandu Peaberry
review: A beautifully balanced, classically sweet-savory Kenya cup with great depth and sweet, musky resonance.

name: Ethiopia Idido Wegida
review: A deeply sweet washed-process Ethiopia cup, spice-toned with elegant suggestions of dried stone fruit.

name: Kenya Kirinyaga
review: A balanced, sweet-savory Kenya cup with classic currant notes and a rich bittersweet undercurrent suggesting hop flowers throughout.

name: Ethiopia Herfusa Single Variety Natural
review: A cleanly fruit-driven natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup, berry- and nut-toned with sweet florals throughout.

name: Mbeguka Kenya
review: A deeply sweet Kenya with classic red berry notes, bittersweet florals, and minty herb notes.

name: Guatemala La Folie
review: A friendly, accessible Guatemala cup that leads with pleasing nut tones supported by spice-toned fruit. Gentle though expressive acidity.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Washed
review: A delicate, accessible, pretty Ethiopia cup with attractive citrus and chocolate notes.

name: Costa Rica Farmer’s Project
review: An appealing blend of Costa Rica coffees that supports a local farmer’s collective: crisp, sweet and balanced.

name: Organic Unicorn Espresso Blend
review: A straightforward espresso blend, adeptly dark-roasted to highlight deep florals and rich chocolate.

name: Guatemala Concepción Buena Vista
review: A friendly, accessible Central America cup, crisply sweet with notes of stone fruit, cocoa and hazelnut.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Aricha G1
review: A classic washed Yirgacheffe cup: bright and lively with juicy, vibrant acidity.

name: El Salvador Las Mercedes Pacamara Honey
review: A deeply sweet Pacamara cup with savory undertones throughout, reminiscent of fine musk and marjoram-like sweet herbs.

name: Sumatra Raja Harimau Lintong Espresso
review: An intense and gratifying Sumatran coffee, offering the qualities that make Sumatra an exciting origin for many coffee lovers (earth/tobacco, cocoa, sweetness, citrus) without the overly pungent earthy characteristics that often shadow this origin. For those who appreciate the type, this coffee is superb and rewarding.

name: Panama Esmeralda Geisha Portón Oro Yeast
review: An exceptionally high-toned natural-processed Panama Geisha coffee with especially vibrant acidity, balanced structure, and deep floral notes throughout the profile.

name: Kenya Kiambu Peaberry Uklili 1904 Lot
review: A crisp, sweet-toned, cocoa-laden Kenya cup elevated by citrusy floral notes.

name: Kenya Kiambu AB Uklili 1903 Lot
review: A chocolaty and floral-toned Kenya cup with ballast from zesty citrus and rich aromatic wood.

name: Ethiopia Natural Yirgacheffe Blue Donkey Lot #2
review: An exceptionally purely expressed natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup, berry- and nut-driven, supported by spicy floral notes throughout.

name: Ethiopia Nansebo Worka
review: An elegant, high-toned, washed-process Yirgacheffe cup saturated with floral and fruit notes throughout and a particularly engaging sweet-citrusy acidity.

name: Puna Champagne Natural Anaerobic
review: A fruit- and floral-toned coffee from a lesser-known growing region on the Big Island of Hawai’i is worth seeking out for its balanced completeness and its suggestions of the tropics, both aromatically and in the cup.

name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Red Honey
review: A sweet, multi-layered Costa Rica cup, its rich fruit amplified by skillful red honey processing.

name: Refisa Ethiopia
review: A classically bright, floral-toned washed Ethiopia cup with added vivacity from stone fruit and citrus notes.

name: La Lindura Colombia
review: A balanced Colombia cup with notes of stonefruit and citrus on top and deep cocoa and rich aromatic wood underneath.

name: Butare Huye of Rwanda
review: A Rwanda cup pleasingly balanced between sweet fruit and chocolate and rich aromatic wood.

name: La Finca Medina of Guatemala
review: Enjoy this straightforward Central America cup for its mild acidity and its sweet nut and deep floral notes.

name: Peaberry Blend
review: An attractive choice for lovers of darker-roasted blends: sweet chocolate and flowers alongside dried fruit notes, with prominent smoky wood throughout.

name: 2019 Celebration
review: A roast-forward blend that emphasizes chocolate and floral notes while developing the savory inclination of the green coffees as well: rich, musky, sweet. Might be particularly nice — apologies to purists — with a splash of milk.

name: Holiday Blend
review: A complex, layered coffee with both classic Kenya (red currant) and Ethiopia (berry, cocoa) leanings.

name: Holiday Sweet Blend
review: An integrated, harmonious blend of washed- and natural-process coffees that highlights both sweet (blueberry) and tart (tamarind) fruits with big chocolate throughout.

name: Winter Solstice Blend
review: A sweetly nutty and cocoa-toned cup with an especially buoyant mouthfeel.

name: Festivity Blend
review: An engaging, delicately spice-inflected blend pleasingly complicated by chocolate and citrus zest.

name: Holiday Blend
review: A subtle, nuanced cup rich with notes of spicy florals and baking spices with an appealing berry throughline.

name: Invincible Sun God
review: This coffee’s name is loosely drawn from the name of the winter solstice celebration for Mithraism, "Natalis Solis Invincti," which means “birthday of the unconquerable sun.” Drink it if for no other reason than this.

name: Wonderland Winter Solstice Holiday Blend
review: A friendly, balanced blend, equally sweet and tart, animated by a delicate cocoa.

name: Dark Roast Holiday Blend
review: An interesting blend skillfully dark-roasted, save for the bitter, burned finish. Otherwise, quietly intriguing, sweet and smoky.

name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Espresso Mekuriya Gobena
review: A richly sweet, delicately tart natural-process Yirgacheffe cup, deftly roasted toward the darker end of medium to develop chocolate notes without dampening the bright fruit and sweet flowers.

name: Ethiopia Shakiso
review: An elegant, richly-layered single-farm Ethiopia cup. Natural processing develops sweet berry notes throughout.

name: Madagascar Yellow Bourbon Santatra Coop
review: An intriguing cup from the little-known coffee-producing region Madagascar: sweet, tart, balanced and inviting.

name: Finca La Montana Costa Rica
review: A richly sweet and fruit-forward Costa Rica cup with a developed roast profile that highlights chocolate and floral tones.

name: Berg Wu Championship Selection Yirgacheffe G1 Natural Lot 19/01
review: A lively, engaging, cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed Yirgacheffe cup deepened by low-toned florals akin to fine musk.

name: Ethiopia Mulegeta Sintayehu Washed
review: A complex, resonant washed Ethiopia cup, fruit- and flora-laden, with an especially inviting bright, juicy acidity.

name: Ethiopia Sidamo Bensa Asefa Dukamo Washed
review: An engaging, complex yet accessible washed Ethiopia cup characterized by crisp fruit and deep floral tones.

name: Panama Esmeralda Geisha Natural
review: A high-toned, richly floral natural-processed Geisha cup from the famed Hacienda La Esmeralda farm in Boquete, Panama animated by crisp, citrusy fruit notes throughout.

name: Ethiopia Suke Quto Honey
review: A deeply nuanced coffee with bittersweet citrus and sweet florals in front and ballast from rich chocolate and nougat.

name: Single-Origin Espresso
review: Gently smoky aromatic wood frames this deeply chocolaty single-origin espresso with pretty floral and fruit notes, particularly attractive in three parts milk.

name: Kenya FSC AB
review: A big, chocolaty Kenya cup with deep floral notes throughout and a particularly engaging, syrupy-smooth body.

name: Colombia Pink Bourbon
review: A rich-toned Colombia cup characterized by tart red fruit and citrus notes supported by deep florals and a crisp sweetness akin to maple syrup.

name: Guatemala Acatenango Geisha
review: An accessible Guatemala Geisha with floral top notes and stone fruit and cocoa tones in the cup.

name: Kenya Kiambu “Summer Love”
review: A friendly, accessible medium-roasted Kenya cup with sweet fruit and floral notes throughout.

name: El Salvador Pacamara Honey
review: An aromatic-wood-framed, honey-processed Pacamara from El Salvador with depth from cocoa and spice tones.

name: Ethiopia Sidamo
review: A washed Sidamo cup with a developed roast profile that  amplifies chocolate and floral notes; deeply and richly sweet throughout.

name: Colombia
review: A deftly medium-roasted Colombia cup, balanced and satisfying in its familiar pleasures.

name: Kenya Zuri
review: A straightforward, accessible Kenya cup with big chocolate notes as a throughline.

name: Guatemala Dark Roast FTO
review: A darker-roasted Guatemala coffee that highlights pleasing cocoa and dried fruit notes.

name: Honduras Atanacio Nolasco
review: A pleasing, balanced Honduras cup with pretty nut tones throughout.

name: Ethiopia Sidamo
review: An easy-drinking natural-processed Ethiopia cup with ballast from spice-toned aromatic wood and florals.

name: Sidamo Suke Quto
review: A medium-roasted Ethiopia cup with pleasing cocoa and citrus notes throughout; wood-centered in the finish.

name: Guatemala (from bulk bin)
review: A good-value darker roasted Guatemala driven by quiet chocolate and nut notes.

name: Colombia
review: A comfortingly familiar, darker roasted Colombia cup built around dark chocolate with undertones of vanilla-like florals.

name: Colombia
review: A roast-prominent, cocoa-toned Colombia cup with an intriguing sweet-tart note.

name: 100% Guatemalan
review: A sweet though muted Guatemala cup: roasty cocoa and nut.

name: Sumatra Dark
review: A good choice for those who like classic dark-roasted Sumatras: earthy-sweet, smoky chocolate.

name: 100% Kona Bourbon Pointu Laurina
review: An aromatically complex, original cup that balances an enveloping sweetness with a quietly forceful pungency.

name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Geisha Natural Special Auction ES-N-2
review: An elegant, subtle coffee with leading notes of stonefruit and cocoa nib and especially lively acidity.

name: Lian House Blend Espresso
review: A roast-prominent, chocolaty, sweetly nutty espresso blend with deep, subtle smoke tones throughout.

name: Ethiopia Guji Uraga Wolisho Natural
review: A balanced, straightforward natural-process Ethiopia cup: sweetly tart, chocolaty, with a hint of spicy florals throughout.

name: Lian House Blend
review: An accessible, sweet-toned blend with gentle fruit and floral notes and nut and aromatic wood undertones.

name: Guatemala Maragogype La Providencia
review: A striking cup from this rare variety: sweet, tart, rich, deep, and floral through and through.

name: El Salvador Finca El Cerro Natural
review: A resonantly fruit-forward, cocoa-toned natural-processed Pacamara cup, with high-toned florals and richly bittersweet citrus notes throughout.

name: Halo Hartume Espresso
review: A confident single-origin espresso, savory-leaning, with rich florality and dark chocolate notes resonating throughout the cup and in three parts milk.

name: Tanzania AA Karatu Estate
review: An impeccably balanced, nuanced Tanzania cup that is an extraordinary value at $12 for 12 ounces.

name: Ethiopia Yetagesu Bulebula
review: A classic washed Yirgacheffe cup: bright, lively, redolent of stone fruit, citrus zest and cocoa.

name: Ethiopia Guji Darii Kojowa Grade 1
review: An inviting, rich-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with clear blueberry and chocolate notes and gentle acidity.

name: Kenya Kevota Makengi
review: A robust, hearty Kenya, driven by sweet-pungent grapefruit and cedar, softened by dark chocolate suggestions.

name: Ethiopia Reko Estate Yirgacheffe
review: Sweet flowers and intense sandalwood power this silky-bodied, fragrant Yirgacheffe.

name: Le Roi Espresso
review: A quietly balanced espresso: crisp, sweet, driven by dry chocolate and bittersweet orange.

name: Ethiopia Sidama Anaerobic
review: A quietly original, resonant cup, exquisitely balanced and complete.

name: Kenya Kiri Peaberry
review: A deeply rich, big-bodied Kenya cup foregrounding spice notes, berries and bittersweet florals.

name: Kenya Nyeri AA Ichuga
review: A solid Kenya cup: chocolaty, spice-toned, deeply sweet.

name: Wolde Hirbe Natural Espresso
review: A pleasingly balanced natural-process Ethiopia roasted for espresso, with tropical flowers and citrus zest as primary notes, supported by a molasses-like sweetness.

name: Hacienda La Esmeralda Geisha Panama
review: An accessible Geisha cup characterized by tropical fruit and cocoa notes throughout with intimations of honey-like florals.

name: San Sebastian Colombia
review: A big-bodied Colombia driven by crisp chocolate and nut intrigue rounded by cherryish fruit.

name: La Coipa Peru
